Text:
In honor of #BlackHistoryMonth, @TheBlackCaucus and @JECDems released new analysis of the current economic status of Black Americans, celebrating the progress that has been made and recognizing the challenges that remain. #JECxCBC
https://t.co/vUFf0nHOlW

The DOJ and Biden Admin are continuing to take action—and so will Congress & @FSCDems.
 
That’s why @RepRitchie & I introduced the Real Estate Valuation Fairness & Improvement Act to combat discrimination in America’s real estate appraisal industry.
https://t.co/Og6hHDT54L

The bias Black Americans face in home appraisals is undeniable. People of color continue to raise alarming concerns about the devaluation of minority homeownership and unfair appraisal practices. 
https://t.co/CLgXWy5Pbr

The U.S. & European allies must stand united in response to Russia’s blatant disregard for international law, self-determination, & territorial sovereignty.
 
These sanctions—in addition to pausing Nord Stream 2—are critical steps toward punishing Putin & his cronies. https://t.co/hHeO6GFlZh

As the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law funding continues to be released,  I look forward to working with local stakeholders and community leaders to ensure the Bi-State Sustainable Reinvestment Corridor is a success—making our entire region the Green Hub of the Heartland! https://t.co/KReb16qEvq

Not only will these investments help our communities cut down on unhealthy pollution, harmful emissions, and speed our transition to a clean energy economy—but it will also create a lot of good-paying jobs and spur economic development in the process!

The Bi-State Sustainable Reinvestment Corridor will also target federal grant funding to provide green infrastructure, broadband access, safety an security enhancements, affordable housing and other critical infrastructure all along the corridor. https://t.co/dxksqnWYa0

The thread that will tie these communities together—and unlock greater opportunity for the entire region—will be a 24-mile zero-emission regional transit route with improved access to housing, health care, employment, and education for citizens in each city and surrounding area.

Using federal funds from the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, the Bi-State Sustainable Reinvestment Corridor will focus on a wide-range of investment opportunities to create a sustainable corridor that connects 3 major cities in 2 states, 2 counties, and 2 congressional districts. https://t.co/S7kd25MaYS

“We are stronger as a collective than we are as individual jurisdictions.”

Proud to join @RepDavids, @CityOfIndepMO, @JacksonCountyMO, @KCMO, @UnifiedGovt to announce plans for the Bi-State Sustainable Reinvestment Corridor, a collaborative, green infrastructure initiative. https://t.co/aCVUyuis80

In the face of Russian aggression, it’s important for those of us who believe in democracy & self-determination to #StandWithUkraine in their time of need.

I’m proud to join @USRepKeating & transatlantic legislators to show we are #UnitedWithUkraine https://t.co/lZEnWXHG0O https://t.co/LznZ9ID8T5

President Biden’s nominees to the Federal Reserve are supremely qualified for the positions they are set to assume.

It’s time for the Senate to confirm these economic experts without further delay. 
https://t.co/fkZcL9aKdg

Clean energy is the future of Missouri & the United States as a whole. 

That’s why I was proud to help deliver more than $14 million through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law to help build out EV charging infrastructure across the Show Me State.

This is how we #BuildBackBetter! https://t.co/y71SPWlEjz https://t.co/P2FViAQLM1

Thanks to the #AmericanRescuePlan’s expansion of the Earned Income Tax Credit, more than one-third of young American workers will receive an average tax cut of more than $800 this year!
https://t.co/yz881o0F9U

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law isn’t just expanding broadband to make it accessible in every community in America—it’s providing support to ensure internet is affordable for families, too!

See if you're eligible for the Affordable Connectivity Program:https://t.co/5KuabSwDf8 https://t.co/neuXpLT4Yv

The USPS is essential to Americans who receive lifesaving medications, hard-earned paychecks, and other important items in the mail.

That’s why I was proud to support the Postal Service Reform Act to save taxpayer dollars and ensure the agency is running efficiently! https://t.co/i7ShhCvJZg

For too long, we have failed to invest in fair & affordable housing—which has left American families paying more for less, & far too many of our neighbors with no home at all.

It’s time to #ShowHousingLove by passing the historic housing investments from the #BuildBackBetterAct! https://t.co/NGFReM9jHE

Today, I stand with the Parkland community to remember:

Alyssa
Scott
Martin
Nicholas
Aaron
Jaime
Chris
Luke
Cara
Gina
Joaquin
Alaina
Meadow
Helena
Alex
Carmen
Peter

#MSDStrong
https://t.co/jxw2UPswMO

4 years ago, the Parkland community had 17 lives stolen during one of the worst school shootings in American history.

Today, let us remember the souls taken and honor their memory by remaining #MSDStrong and enacting common sense gun safety laws.

If we want to level the playing field for working class Americans, we must prioritize strengthening organized labor.
 
Good to see @POTUS and @VP focusing on ways in which their administration can do that.
https://t.co/KoqJocKaTm

The @USPS delivers life-saving medications, hard-earned paychecks, and so much more to Missouri families.
 
That’s why I was proud to support the #PostalServiceReformAct, which will ensure the USPS operates efficiently and effectively for years to come.
https://t.co/vdnUabxYju

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law continues to provide funding that will help communities all over Missouri #BuildBackBetter—this time to the tune of $46 million to modernize our transportation systems, obtain new & sustainable buses & railcars, and support good-paying jobs! https://t.co/3YVwtCrvZQ

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law continues to deliver for the Show Me State!

Thanks to @POTUS’ infrastructure law that I was proud to support, Missouri communities are receiving $14.6M this year to build EV charging infrastructure, create jobs, & begin #ElectrifyingAmerica. https://t.co/7qyff6VPTF

So happy to see @SwopeHealth and @MARCKCMetro receiving national recognition for their tireless effort to keep Kansas City kids healthy and protect our communities.
 
Congratulations on this esteemed honor and keep up the phenomenal work! https://t.co/odOp4C5jvv

With these overdue investments, we have an opportunity to connect communities throughout #MO05—which will help workers find more opportunities, enable greater economic development, and ensure the KC Region grows in an equitable fashion.
 
More info here:
https://t.co/LXWMAiv0KK

Thrilled to announce another $46 million from @POTUS’ Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is headed to Missouri to modernize our public transportation systems, support good-paying transit jobs, & fund critical local projects. 
 
This is how we #BuildBackBetter! https://t.co/fMDkP2Abl7

Post offices are the centerpiece of local communities across the United States. 

That’s why I will proudly vote for the #PostalServiceReformAct, which will put the USPS on solid financial footing and ensure they deliver mail and packages at least 6 days per week. https://t.co/8P1stapehq

Thanks to @HouseDemocrats & @POTUS:
-GDP grew 5.7% last year—the most in 40 years
-6.6 million jobs were created—the most in American history
-The unemployment rate dropped to 3.9%--the largest single year drop on record
 
Let’s continue working to #BuildBackBetter! https://t.co/UiltFvcH13

Electric vehicles aren’t just good for the environment—they’re great for economic development and good-paying union jobs like those @UAW249!
 
That’s why the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law includes historic investments in EV infrastructure that will help accelerate our transition. https://t.co/0Y5rlXpD0Z

If you still need help enrolling with Medicaid, make sure you stop by the @KCMOHealthDept today for assistance in getting quality, affordable health care.
 
More information from @SwopeHealth here: https://t.co/zrcsH9bhLp

If your family is eligible for the expanded #ChildTaxCredit, make sure to file your taxes to ensure you get your full benefit.
 
Find more information and check your eligibility here:
https://t.co/DYe1yglmUB

Since @HouseDemocrats passed @POTUS’ expanded #ChildTaxCredit, it has:
-Supported 61M kids
-Kept nearly 4M kids out of poverty
-Cut child poverty by 40%

I was proud to support this historic tax cut, and I’ll keep working to make it permanent!
https://t.co/YElYkRomHl

Pro-union policies are critical to combatting the massive income-inequality gap that has set hardworking families back for decades now.
 
Thankful to have an administration fighting for American workers—not just those at the very top! https://t.co/Dk9YLrYTY2

Thanks to @POTUS, the last year has had the:
-Greatest 12 months of job creation in American history
-Largest drop in unemployment rate on record
-Largest reduction in child poverty in a single year
-Strongest economic growth in 40 years
 
#BuildBackBetter
https://t.co/0JLx2UgUhG

In the wealthiest nation in the history of the world, no one should go to sleep at night without a roof over their head.
 
That’s why I held a hearing last week to discuss how @FSCDems and Congress will continue to battle #Homelessness in America.

More information here: https://t.co/Uhcav6FdQl

No victim of sexual assault or harassment should be compelled to silence due to forced arbitration. Tragically, that is still far too often the outcome for American workers.
 
Today, I will proudly vote for @RepCheri’s bipartisan bill to #EndForcedArbitration. #EnoughIsEnough https://t.co/vbpZslOGu0

What occurred on January 6th was a despicable attack on American democracy itself. 

It was absolutely not “legitimate political discourse.”
 
See for yourself:
https://t.co/nDHX49tsBi https://t.co/TzoQQ12BL2

I am elated by this historic announcement! 

Congrats to @KCMOHealthDept’s newly appointed director, Dr. Marvia Jones. I have no doubt that Dr. Jones’ unremitting commitment to public health & safety will continue to positively shape the lives of Kansas Citians. https://t.co/l30QsZX096
@POTUS’ #CancerMoonshot initiative takes the necessary steps towards advancing cancer research, prioritizing prevention, and addressing inequities in access to screening, diagnostics, and treatment.

I pray that one day we will have a cancer free world. Today, on #WorldCancerDay, I join the global community in raising awareness about cancer’s impact & honor the many lives it has shaped. https://t.co/2hqWEQr9xA

In the 2nd month of 2022, the U.S. will exceed the number of gun violence deaths that other countries see throughout an entire year.

This National Gun Violence Week, let us all come together and recommit to enacting common sense gun safety laws that will save American lives. https://t.co/OrHn44vStr

Not only did the January #JobsReport blow past expectations, the November and December reports were revised up by 700,000.
 
Let’s continue to build on the #BidenBoom by passing a #BuildBackBetter bill that lowers costs for hardworking families! https://t.co/l1fimwT7Un

For decades, we have failed to rebuild our manufacturing base & strengthen supply chains, leaving us vulnerable to crises like the global pandemic.
 
#AmericaCOMPETES makes investments that will bolster American manufacturing & ensure we are competitive for generations to come. https://t.co/5FuUIgJepW

Today, I was proud to support the #AmericaCOMPETES Act, which will address challenges to the supply chain, expand economic opportunities and lower costs for hardworking families, and strengthen America’s middle class. https://t.co/hPPWXKPXbB

Thanks to @POTUS and the American Rescue Plan, 2021 saw the greatest job growth in history, with 6.4 million jobs created.
 
In 2022, The #BidenBoom continues to crush expectations with another 467,000 jobs added and wages up 5.7% last month! https://t.co/lC3HZWdK4T

Hospitals should be working to keep their patients—not profits—healthy during a global pandemic. 

With the American public already facing exorbitant health care costs, it’s important that these troubling allegations are investigated.
https://t.co/BobEsMnsaN

Honored to participate in these important community discussions with @MCCKansasCity to celebrate #BlackHistoryMonth.

Look forward to speaking with you later this month! https://t.co/Pbrxi4AJeZ

It’s no secret that rural Missourians have the longest commutes and, in turn, spend the most on gas—which is why they stand to benefit greatly from the transition to electric vehicles.

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will help rural communities get there quicker. https://t.co/uCmkKObK5i

That’s why I introduced the Restoring Worker Power Act with Rep. Kennedy during the 116th Congress to close these labor loopholes—because I believe that every worker deserves equal pay for equal work. 
https://t.co/epbPvAK6rm

The global pandemic has led to a rapid expansion of the temp worker industry—where workers receive smaller paychecks, fewer benefits, and less stability.

It’s a growing problem, and it’s critical that Congress take action.
https://t.co/W0JAswdSvr

#BlackHistory is American history. 

This #BlackHistoryMonth, it’s important that we honor the legacies and tell the stories of those who blazed the trail for us today. 

Honored to participate in this project from @KCLibrary, @BlackArchivesKC, & @kclinc.
https://t.co/ttcYR0uGTm https://t.co/bGUkWVPl66

Every day, more than 110 Americans are killed due to gun violence.
 
This National Gun Violence Survivors Week, let us reaffirm our commitment to enacting common sense gun safety laws that will ensure no more families have to endure such senseless suffering. #GVSurvivorsWeek https://t.co/97FyIM72Y4

#AmericaCOMPETES when we invest in science & the latest technologies—which fuel innovation & the American public’s inherent entrepreneurial spirit.
 
The America COMPETES Act will make these critical, long overdue investments so we remain competitive throughout the 21st century. https://t.co/JMMhfbk0RQ

The American people overwhelmingly support Congress taking action to #LowerDrugCosts for seniors and hardworking families.

Provisions from the #BuildBackBetter Act would do just that.

Proud to join @RepSusanWild in calling on leadership to immediately pass them. https://t.co/lJ76UTd0AN

If we’re going to #BuildBackBetter, then housing must be at the heart.
 
Today, I’m chairing a hearing to discuss how federal investments to increase the affordable housing supply will help lower costs for hardworking families & address housing insecurity.
https://t.co/eY1ydn99vt

Sending love and prayers to my friend, @SenatorLujan, for a full and speedy recovery.
 
New Mexico and the United States Senate are lucky to have him—and I have no doubt he will be back and eager to serve as soon as possible. https://t.co/ZXFcxePgQW

No student should have to fear for their life while trying to better it through higher education. Sadly, HBCUs continue to see increased threats of violence.
 
Those responsible for these despicable efforts at intimidation must be held accountable. https://t.co/oKJtKMfDJP

Happy #LunarNewYear to all those celebrating in #MO05 and around the world!
 
May this #YearOfTheTiger bring you good health, prosperity, and lots of love!

After a decade of work to improve air quality in Jackson County, this is phenomenal news!
 
Congratulations to @JacksonCountyMO on this accomplishment—and let’s continue working together to #BuildBackBetter with clean air and water for ALL Missourians!
https://t.co/DzozvX7XSS

Today, we kick off #BlackHistoryMonth—where we honor and celebrate the courage, creativity, and contributions of African Americans throughout our shared history.
 
This month, let us reflect on the triumphs of the past while recommitting to a better future. #OurPowerOurMessage. https://t.co/4WjITSPhdW

Please be careful and do not take this winter storm lightly, Kansas City!
 
With the potential for up to a foot of snow tomorrow, it’s important that you take steps now and be prepared to stay home for the next day or two.  
https://t.co/aUASbts5cB

That’s why I joined @RepSusanWild calling on @SpeakerPelosi and @SenSchumer to immediately pass legislation that would:

-Allow Medicare to negotiate drug prices.
-Cap out-of-pocket costs for seniors in Medicare Part D
-Cap insulin prices at $35 per month https://t.co/M9PXsAmgBR

I couldn’t agree more with @AARP—it’s time for Congress to #LowerDrugCosts so hardworking families in Missouri don’t have to choose between getting life-saving medications and putting food on the table.
 
We must #BuildBackBetter! https://t.co/Qb3dxBRCzL

82 years ago, Ida May Fuller received the very first #SocialSecurity check.
 
Today, I’m proud to be a cosponsor of Social Security 2100: A Sacred Trust, which would expand and enhance benefits for Social Security recipients today. #Secure2100 https://t.co/m47ZO8CDYT

If you haven’t yet, please take some time to get your booster shot against COVID. It could save your life.
 
Find a free, safe, and effective vaccine at https://t.co/u3eUle8Ix8 https://t.co/wrEux6A2SE

It’s going to take a coordinated effort from federal, state, & local officials to #BuildABetterAmerica.

Today, @POTUS & @MitchLandrieu46 released a guidebook to help local officials better access federal funding from the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law.
https://t.co/a887CaNmWo

If you have friends or family in Kansas City, make sure you check in on them today.
 
We’re all struggling with a severe case of what could have been. https://t.co/1p6I6ty5t9

If the U.S. is going to win the 21st century, then we need to make critical investments that bolster American manufacturing and increase technological innovation—which will strengthen our economy and lower prices for hardworking families.
 
This is how we #BuildBackBetter https://t.co/Htwi9azIfq

As Chair of the Subcommittee on Housing, expanding broadband & providing affordable internet service has been a priority—which is why I co-introduced the Broadband Justice Act with @RepBowman to expand affordable broadband to another 8 million households.
https://t.co/RzZk3ytIhn

High-quality internet isn’t accessible if it’s not affordable.
 
That’s why @HouseDemocrats included the Affordable Connectivity Program in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, which provides up to $30 off a family’s monthly internet bill.
 
More info here: https://t.co/5KuabSw5pA

Thankful no lives were lost.
 
This is why the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law @POTUS delivered was so critical. Not only will it create good-paying jobs & strengthen our economy, it’s going to ensure safer roads, bridges, and public transportation that Americans rely on every day. https://t.co/4arKXRrcLC

This week, I introduced a bipartisan resolution with @RepSamGraves designating #NationalPassengerSafetyWeek to highlight the role passengers can play in stemming the recent rise in traffic tragedies.
 
Happy to see @SecretaryPete and @POTUS focusing on this critical issue. https://t.co/DL0btiP4gB

The #AmericanRescuePlan made critical investments in the ACA that helped to lower health care costs and expand access for hardworking families.
 
Now, a record number of Americans have been able to obtain quality insurance.
 
This is how we #BuildBackBetter! https://t.co/iTcLhg3d4X

Today, Americans are finding better jobs with better pay & better benefits thanks to the economic policies of @POTUS.

Now, let’s build on this progress with legislation that will bolster our supply chains & strengthen manufacturing so we can lower costs on hardworking families. https://t.co/oAQgz90rK6

On #HolocaustRemembranceDay, #WeRemember the 6 million Jews and millions other victims murdered by the Nazi regime.

Let us honor the victims by reaffirming our commitment to fighting anti-Semitism & hatred in all forms so that such atrocities can never be replicated. #NeverAgain https://t.co/E2npUvbbZl

Higher prices caused by COVID & outsourcing of American manufacturing are weighing on hardworking families.

To lower prices & bolster our economy, Congress must pass the #AmericaCOMPETES Act, which will invest $45 billion to strengthen supply chains and manufacturing in America. https://t.co/SG7Qe6IqSM

For decades, Justice Breyer has honorably served the American public as a pragmatic voice of reason on the federal bench, dedicating his life to upholding the rule of law.
 
I thank him for his remarkable run of public service and wish him a peaceful, well-earned retirement. https://t.co/Nuse3b4hmS

Free high-quality N95 masks are now available at local grocery stores and pharmacies across Kansas City thanks to the Biden administration.
 
With cases and hospitalizations still high in Missouri, please #MaskUp to protect our communities.
https://t.co/GSdYsniwZx

By designating this week as #NationalPassengerSafetyWeek, we can raise awareness and help educate Americans about the role passengers play in preventing traffic tragedies. 
 
More information on the bipartisan resolution from @RepSamGraves and I here:
https://t.co/G1Fv8tZZiE

Whether it’s asking your friend to wear a seatbelt or taking the keys from a family member who has had too much to drink, it’s incredibly important that passengers speak up when they get in the car with someone who may be distracted, impaired, or driving dangerously.

In recent years, we’ve seen a troubling rise in traffic fatalities—and it’s important to understand we all have a role in preventing these tragedies, including passengers.
 
That’s why I’m proud to introduce a resolution marking #NationalPassengerSafetyWeek with @RepSamGraves.

Assistance to working class families provides tangible benefits to the future of America’s children.
 
That’s why I’m fighting hard to extend President Biden’s expanded #ChildTaxCredit for Missouri families.
https://t.co/Dhqgl3G370

Thanks to @POTUS and the Biden administration, free N95 masks are being made available this week in pharmacies and community health centers across the country.
 
Please continue to #MaskUp to keep our communities safe! https://t.co/LZO6XmGMcv

The 2022 tax season is now underway!
 
Want to speed up the process? File electronically as early as possible and opt for direct deposit.
 
Find more helpful information on how to file here:
https://t.co/3UZNLNvAq1

.@POTUS has made COVID tests available to every household in America as we work to stop the spread of this deadly virus and continue our economic recovery.
 
Make sure you order your tests today by going to https://t.co/BDqk4my0Fb https://t.co/rf0zsgmThV

Masking in schools helps stop the spread of COVID—which helps keep our schools open and running properly.

With cases still high, please continue to take precautions that will keep our communities safe.

Get vaccinated and boosted. Wear a mask. Get tested.
https://t.co/fds0wK0vI8

“In February 2021, the Congressional Budget Office forecast a 5.3% unemployment rate at the end of 2021. Thanks to the Biden Administration’s $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan, passed the following month, the jobless rate fell to 3.9% by November.”
https://t.co/1BiMr0HCxg

All I have to say this morning is:
 
How.
 
Bout.
 
Them.
 
CHIEFS!!! https://t.co/bZMSHOPfxb

.@POTUS and the Biden administration are making FREE COVID-19 tests available to every household in America.
 
Make sure you order your tests today by calling 800-232-0233 or visiting https://t.co/BDqk4my0Fb https://t.co/05ZK3K55H4

The TRUST in Congress Act increases transparency and government accountability by preventing any potential for insider trading from Members of Congress. It’s common sense.
 
Let’s pass it into law. https://t.co/w3NiLPvgGS

We’re running out of time to #ActOnClimate.

It is imperative that Congress make historic investments to combat the #ClimateCrisis and protect our planet for future generations.

That’s why we must pass the climate provisions from the #BuildBackBetter Act.
https://t.co/hUrErQqDwb

If we’re going to truly #BuildBackBetter, then we need to start building in America again.
 
With the economic policies of @POTUS and the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law’s investment in American manufacturing, that’s exactly what we’re going to do.
https://t.co/4jzMiybHmf

Find our report on higher education’s failure to utilize diverse asset managers from Rep. Kennedy and I here:
https://t.co/hpKETOIZhn

Commitment to diversity should be reflected in all levels of an institution—from students to faculty to individuals managing colossal endowments.
 
While universities like @Stanford & @Princeton are moving in the right direction, more must follow suit to ensure equal opportunity.

In 2020, @JoeKennedy and I called on 25 top colleges and universities across the country, including Stanford, to release data on the diversity of asset managers who control multi-billion dollar endowment funds:
https://t.co/6amI4XEYzD

After calling on colleges and universities across the country to diversify the managers of their billion-dollar endowments, I’m pleased to see @Stanford taking concrete steps in the right direction by creating their Diverse Manager Initiative.
https://t.co/AdIuDj3DOW

It is critical that the American people know their representatives in Congress are voting for the best interests of the people—not their own stock portfolios.
 
That’s why I’m proud to cosponsor @RepSpanberger’s TRUST in Congress Act.
https://t.co/xr2ZLpHYLm

Since @POTUS & @VP took office:
 
-210 million Americans vaccinated
-6.4 million jobs created
-3.9% unemployment rate
-Historic Bipartisan Infrastructure Law enacted
-5 million Americans gained health insurance
 
Much work left to do, but we’re making good progress! https://t.co/Qhqb353NEV

This afternoon, I tested positive for COVID-19. While I am experiencing very minor cold-like symptoms, I am confident I will be protected from severe illness because I am vaccinated and boosted.
 
My statement:
https://t.co/aqOW2ADHy5

Welcome to the family, Congresswoman Cherfilus-McCormick!
 
#OurPowerOurMessage https://t.co/pvX5m4sGhv

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is delivering for Missouri!
 
I was proud to support this historic funding for the Show Me State, which will increase driver safety, cut down on commute times, and help small businesses get goods to market—all while creating good-paying jobs! https://t.co/FBBh95Jlrm

As the global pandemic continues to wrangle supply chains, @POTUS’ Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will soon deliver $14 billion to reduce bottlenecks, increase shipping capacity, & lower costs for American consumers.

Still work to do, but this is progress.
https://t.co/NU1APRd3OK

35% of mail-in ballot applications in Harris County received as of this week have been rejected for reasons stemming from Texas’ new voter suppression law.
 
“What we’re seeing here is a direct byproduct of SB1, which simply makes voting more difficult.” https://t.co/Iug7Ec4zIu

Masking, along with getting vaccinated, is one of the best tools we have to combat COVID-19 & save lives.
 
Happy to see @POTUS delivering 400 million N95 masks to Americans this month.
 
As these top-of-the-line masks are made available, please do your patriotic duty and #MaskUp https://t.co/yhbJefEgsg

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is a blue-collar blueprint to modernize our critical infrastructure, create good-paying jobs, increase economic growth, and lower costs and congestion for Missouri travelers. 

This is how we begin to #BuildBackBetter! https://t.co/SQIygrWcOt

Housing policies that segregate low-income Americans from greater opportunity are wrong.

If we are going to realize #MLK’s vision of justice, equality, and economic opportunity for every American, then Congress must pass an Economic Fair Housing Act.
https://t.co/0rjorU8LID

Thanks to the efforts of @POTUS and the Biden Administration, FREE rapid COVID-19 tests are now available to the American public. 

Claim up to 4 at-home test kits today, with shipments beginning later this month.

More information at https://t.co/BDqk4my0Fb

“At this hospital, and every one in the Kansas City metro area, most of the COVID patients in the ICU and dying are unvaccinated.”

Please take some time to protect yourself & our communities by getting vaccinated & boosted.

Find a free & safe vaccine at https://t.co/u3eUle8Ix8 https://t.co/Yashzt62m7

We cannot just reiterate the words of Dr. King—we must use those words to inspire us into action.

If the GOP refuses to pass legislation that would protect voting rights for ALL Americans, then Democrats in the Senate must get rid of the filibuster TODAY! https://t.co/CYkgojNhWo

On #MLKDay, we remember the lessons of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

“Change does not roll in on the wheels of inevitability, but comes through continuous struggle.”
 
Today, may we all pay tribute to the legacy of #MLK by continuing the march toward equality and justice for ALL! https://t.co/0BKikkgtKu

There’s a lot to be excited about in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, but one of my personal favorites is the funding to help transition our public and school bus fleets to electric-powered buses.

Great piece on how that’s going to help us combat #ClimateChange here: https://t.co/NSttNoq0T4

The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is sending $97M in 2022 to repair bridges & connect communities throughout the Show Me State!
 
Proud to have helped secure this critical funding, which will support job creation & increase economic growth. 
 
This is how we #BuildBackBetter! https://t.co/ui69z62QoT

A record number of Americans have signed up for quality, affordable health care during #OpenEnrollment.

Make sure you #GetCovered before the open enrollment period ends TOMORROW.

Find a plan for you at https://t.co/v3R3XTRmjc https://t.co/sOk64SQq8v

For the first time in 6 months, families in #MO05 will be without their expanded #ChildTaxCredit—which helped lift millions of children across America out of poverty.

I won’t stop working to pass the #BuildBackBetter Act to extend this tax cut for hardworking Missouri families. https://t.co/XHzRhCrxwk

As the tragedies in NYC & Philadelphia demonstrated, it is imperative that the Senate pass the #BuildBackBetter Act so we can begin to make long overdue improvements to the conditions and safety of federally assisted residents across the country.

It’s time to #PassTheBill!

.@FSCDems have long been fighting to improve the conditions of assisted residents. That’s why we included $65 billion to address health & safety concerns in public housing & $1 billion to improve conditions in HUD-assisted rental properties in the #BuildBackBetter Act.
